title: Pad Prik King - Red Curry Chicken and Long Beans
description: A spicy and aromatic Thai dish featuring red curry chicken and long beans (green beans) in a vibrant, tangy sauce.
overview: Spicy red curry chicken stir-fry with long beans, kaffir lime leaves, and a rich, tangy sauce.

ingredients.title: Main
content: 500g Chicken breast (skinless, boneless), cut into bite-sized pieces

stages.title: Step 1: Prep Ingredients
content: Slice the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Chop the green beans into short segments.
If using, finely chop the serrano peppers.

stages.title: Step 2: Make Sauce
content: In a small container, mix together the sauce ingredients: 1/4 cup chicken stock, 1 1/2 tbsp fish sauce, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp Golden Mountian sauce, and a pinch of black pepper. Set aside.

stages.title: Step 3: Stir Fry
content: Heat 4 tbsp coconut oil in a wok over medium heat. Add the garlic and 2 tbsp Thai red curry paste; stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
Increase the heat and add the chicken. Stir-fry until the chicken is about half-cooked.
Add the kaffir lime leaves and the green beans. Stir-fry until the chicken is nearly cooked and the beans are crisp-tender.
Pour in the prepared sauce and cook until the sauce thickens slightly.

stages.title: Step 4: Serve
content: Serve the dish over hot cooked rice. Garnish with extra serrano peppers or fresh herbs if desired.
